qDMR04JKXr-2C1o27I37qA.text: The staff and the chips here are excellent. Booking essential for inside but the tables outside are available on a first come first served basis. The Aubergine Bayildi as a starter was excellent (£6) followed by roasted salmon on a bed of peas and broad beans. We were too full for dessert but Eton Mess and cheeses were an option. Pricey, but worth it for a special occasion - unless you're rich.

x_skK-wxTudHN-BcJCGE3w.text: I've visited HRH several times and only have good things to say. Service is very good without being intrusive and food, which ranges from simple burgers and chips (the chips are grrreat!) to the best cooked fish I've ever tasted. The decor is old-fashioned in a good sort of way, mixed with a modern twist - tiles, stained glass, etc. There are also tables outside, with heaters, and so is great to have a coffee, or even a meal, while watching the world go by. Always busy for food or just a drink - a real coffee conoisseur I know says it's the best place in Chiswick for an expresso. Only 2 minutes walk from Turnham Green tube station and loads of other nice restaurants around if you don't like the look of the menu! That said, it's a great place which is also open for breakfast - an ace way to start the day!

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom
Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom

wcF-WzksM_AlOIktP8pSFA.text: High Road Brasserie is located on a busy stretch of Chiswick High Road with competition from many chain and independent restaurants. The fact that it's usually buzzing with customers tells its own story.On a lovely heatwave day like this, eating al fresco at this restaurant is a real treat. I was lucky enough to pinch one of the outdoor tables.The food is very good and takes influences from around the world - chicken club from the USA, hummus from the Mediterranean, duck confit from France and some good old English fare like chicken pie.I had some very nice freshly shucked oysters, served with a twist of lemon. The fish soup was exemplary and full of depth served with all the appropriate garnishes. It was too hot to have a full meal and so I finished with their take on a chocolate fondant served with ice cream.It's not a cheap meal but competitive for this part of London. I noticed that they're open all day, serving a breakfast menu as well.

pFgcFN8m49Y8rZmnzTJHMg.text: I just went there today for Afternoon Tea and I was disappointed.  I suggest to take the £5 tea set instead of the £10 tea set.  The scones, with clotted cream and jam is pretty good; Tea is great as well.  But the extra plate of sweets (from the £10 tea set) is just WAAAAAYYY too sweet.  So sweet it almost feel disgusting.  May be because I'm not used to the British taste.  Service was good, no wait for Sunday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. beautiful creative floor tiling
Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. 10 Afternoon tea set

m9_FfPjWSeSZylmzBNNP9A.text: It's hard to know what to make of the High Road Brasserie. On the one hand, it's a very slick restaurant with nice decor and a buzzy, popular atmosphere. There's an extensive menu and the food is good if slightly on the pricey side for this part of town. On the other hand, it isn't very welcoming. The reception at the door is often a bit like a club bouncer. I live near by and I have often eaten here and I have seen it get slightly less busy over time but they still have the attitude that the place is going to be fully booked and you won't get in unless you're on the VIP guest list. It's just a vibe I get and I find that I can usually book a table via OpenTable without a problem.Also, a couple of times recently, I have had the distinct impression that I'm buying bottles of wine but not getting the full measure. Perhaps the waiters were using our bottle to pour wines by the glass for another table. I've seen this happen at other restaurants.On the whole you'd get equally good food and a friendlier atmosphere at the Roebuck down the road (for gastro-pubishness) or at La Trompette (for fine dining).

bw71NXLNC2MFvjT9P-_LKA.text: I love this place, love it, love it, love it.....it's always open for whatver you want and is consisently good with great cocktails, good brunch food, lovely staff who remember you and I won't have a word said against it!! Try a Flirtini cockail (champagne, raspberrys Muir served in a martini glass) followed by the Fruits de Mer with a bottle of Chilen Sauvingon Blanc for a truly romantic dinner....the oysters were spanking fresh as were the razor clams which are so hard to find on restaurant menus...it came with approprite accompaniments and was heaven. A great place for a coffee...drinks, lunch, dinner, breakfast or brunch that somehow manages to be both warm and spot on trend.

8NPXef3mo6-yshDafY1hqA.text: Good food, service rubbish. The host just walked past me twice and then answered the phone before greeting me. Fail. Anyway, everything is ok, not great.

gTtyBGuQGKxulHS-B0-3FA.text: Good place well located on this busy little chiswick strip. Had the Sea Bream with samphire which was nicely executed. Mrs H had the squid which was good - albeit a little lost with too much salad on the plate. I followed up with an excellent creme brulee.The prices are what you would expect - but note this place isn't a bargain. The crowd is not necessarily cool, but is certainly mixed. But this is chiswick after all.

MqUJmc1oAhMzli9hCUHjeA.text: It's slightly too expensive than what the food deserves to be priced at. Nice enough but not quite. Maybe I am being too picky about this place but I ordered a croque-monsieur yet a cheese and ham toastie arrived on a wooden block. Slightly too elaborate presentation for a simple fare for a start, but also if you fancy yourself as a brasserie, please do try to make a decent croque-monsieur. It's not that hard (hint: there is bechamel in it). Do I sound like pedant frenchman? :)

ZVQSFtHUpyDPkPJnLhYdPg.text: Clean pleasant pub/restaurant. A little pricey. service was good, but my onion soup starter was nondescript. Similarly the moules marinieres proved to be ok but the sauce/ stock was bland though over salted. 12% service was added to our bill without any request (and doesn't seem to be voluntary). OK but I will not rush back.....

Qge5Z7kIQ80xpCIZWTZg3Q.text: My sister and I dropped in here for dinner after spending the day at Kew Gardens... we thought it looked inviting, but had no prior knowledge about the place, and no reservation....we were blown away.Even though other reviewers have mentioned needing to book, when we came on a late weekend afternoon, there were plenty of tables and we were quickly seated outside.We ordered a carafe of their house white, which sang and hit high notes of drops of sunshine... it was wonderful - and we could hardly believe that something this good was the lowly, well-priced, house wine.The staff was incredible throughout... we had a wonderfully patient and helpful waitress (I believe we bombarded her with lots of questions and requests for recommendations) who delivered the type of impeccable and decorous service you only really expect in a fine French restaurant.  It was both unexpected and marvelous.The food also astounded.  I had a ratatouille served on a bed of rocket, and I believe my sister had some sort of roast chicken dish.  We both found our entrees to be of *exceptional* quality... they were delicious and both had a very homey and comforting quality.But what floored us the most was the total of our bill... it seemed negligible - couldn't have come to much more than £30 - given the caliber of the food and service that we experienced this seemed like a rock-bottom bargain.We can't wait to dine here again.  In fact, the very existence of this fantastic gem of an establishment is enough for me to contemplate a move to Turnham Green.

DUMWfyexUXRflXNfiZrW6Q.text: We went for my husband's birthday. It was a pretty quiet night and everything moved so quickly that we had a hard time keeping up. The service was a little too efficient as we would have liked to take our time but did feel like the courses came out the second we set our forks down. The restaurant itself is beautiful and it was very pleasing to just sit and look around. My only complaint is that the price did not meet the portion. I thought the portions were great (as most places are tending to over feed us) but the price did not match. All in all, it was a nice evening but if we return it will be for their breakfast only as the dinner was just too expensive for what we got.

RiGS5ilPNSkGcGjGpSlFTA.text: Mmmm jury's out on this one. I'm a big fan of the Soho House empire - SH, Electric, Electric Cinema, Babbington are all favourites of mine. They all offer well designed spaces with the focus on luxury with a touch of uniqueness. But venue is one thing, clientele is another. SH locations have always had a 'them & us' air about them- but they're just about bearable when the venue is populated by creatives & media types. With the Chiswick catchment area of bankers, lawyers & estate agents you get far too many middle-class wannabes who like to look out and gloat. Shame as the venue's contemporary design is a refreshing addition to the High Road. Food is always good (breakfast/brunch excellent), but on the expensive side. Just try & ignore the Hedge Fund Managers!

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom

7RajZ2fEI0DX-O8NhJwiGw.text: As a resident of Chiswick I would say that the clientele here is much more likely to be people in the media discussing film production deals. The secret of the success here is an appealing menu and pleasant atmosphere. The food is unambitious but this means they can deliver it consistently. I think it is a little costly for the level of cooking, but the queues of people suggest this is not a problem for many. For a detailed review see: andyhayler.com/show_rest…

kz5_hIwigBPUFzD6XkubZA.text: Bit overpriced for the food, tastes quite nice but nothing special and therefore should dish out more portions as compensation - Find the staff a bit over officious as well - I like to do things myself - But nice and clean and got some great wines to sample...

j71rX4AlnUqXTj2wJyIh8w.text: We eat here every couple of weeks, and love the modern British menu. Particular favourites are the Sunday Roast and the seafood. Afternoon was a bit too much but delicious nevertheless. The lavender martini is like a small meal in itself and if you can get not the private club downstairs, try the butterscotch martini but do not try to stand up too soon afterwards!

9WgXOh6HvRe5j6lwOfiahw.text: The earlier reviewer pays too much attention to the clientelle. Sure Chiswick isa bit middle class but this place is popular for a reason: very good food, at incredible prices at lunch time and real nice design.

PgRFR8D9LIZoQkjMARIEcg.text: This is one of my favourite place to eat when I can't be faffed going into Central London. The food never fails to come up trumps. It is a contemporary modern styled brassierie and on the plus side the atmosphere doesn't have that coldness that sometimes places of the same ilk does. I am always hungry but I really do like the look of the menu here, it's is always fairly simple fair but very appealing (even if I am a slighty biased piggy), however I tend to always order the foie gras with toasted brioche starter and lobster and chips for main. Yum.

LBo4PIRKM4NWliGJc-3_fw.text: I've only eaten in the quieter, more exclusive 'Upstairs @' restaurant, but the food was excellent if a little pricey for what it was (but no more than some 'gastropubs'). The bistro at street level seems more lively and fun, but if at all possible, attempt to get an invitation to the intimate, quieter surroundings of the members' club. Who knows, you could be sitting next to somebody famous too.

y_I4oRrdnZsaA7IFUuh1eQ.text: Excellent place. Favourite for brunch. Not partcularly child friendly though.

65BjY7wML3FvTEsnpYeZGQ.text: Expensive but worth it. Food and service are great. Always busy but it has a nice atmosphere. Love the decor too, especially the random tiled floor!

seMmxFVrShq2eb0IdgMTwg.text: I enjoy food. I love good food. Service I can understand being spotty when the food is great! I come here 1-2 times a week(I live around the corner) and no matter what time I come service is not just spotty, it's downright terrible. Now the servers ARE super nice, like REALLY nice. But the efficiency and knowledge of the product is lacking. It's frustrating because the burger (YES! The burger!) Is worth a trip here alone! Juicy, flavorful and perfect. The Prawn Cocktail is always cooked to perfection. Tho, entirely too much sauce for my liking is piled on top, but not too thick-I just push the excess to the side.  The cocktails are incredible (Panceca is smokey, sweet, yum) wine list is impressive and the ambiance is wonderful. And the desserts... Wowzah! The cheesecake is not sweet and allows for the fruit on top  to shine. Please for the love of Grace... Work on your service standard. See ya next week!Side note: the management is fantastic as well. I feel like the service will get better..

dyxiz6I7y8-4_avkaKl0jA.text: Its a shame that such lovely venue with beautiful decoration has got awful management as EACH of our 3 couse mean took 45 MIN to come cold and blandThe staff weren't friendly or smiley either! Set menu options didn't taste nor presented good as it was described on The menu We ordered: the cod which was undercooked and very small And medium rare steak on the other side was overcooked to welldone with soggy chips ! And another 45 min wait for a small plate of two tiny slices of absolutely tasteless cheese ! Really disappointing! I do not recommend this place !

KZlIH-CwmeR2xEBoipRpQA.text: Really good food, good drinks, love the atmosphere. Not good service. Wouldn't say poor but definitely not at all good. Would return with friends for casual meal but wouldn't bring guests or host work colleagues there.

XIgrXqa7TxxfoBfB1dXUVQ.text: My husband and I are regulars here, especially for breakfast on weekends, and the food and service are always great. But today's service was superb. We very recently became parents and for months we've planned to come here and have poached eggs (eggs florentine for me in particular) for breakfast once the baby was born and before my husband has to go back to work. I really missed runny eggs and hollandaise when I was pregnant! An even longer story short- they let us order off the breakfast menu after the kitchen was already switching to lunch service. Many restaurants wouldn't have done this. And after 10 long months I finally got the tastiest eggs florentine I'd been craving!

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Eggs florentine, poached egg on avocado toast and a side of bacon

pWk9gLMkabDojilTjhVZ3A.text: Nice place. Good ambience; especially the outdoor seating. One of the best I would say. We went there for a couple of drinks and the staff recommended some fantastic drinks. I loved the High Road Sunset with Cedrata...although I nearly missed getting the right drink! The waiter exchanged drinks while serving them and when asked, he confidently said they were served right. Probably the aperol in both drinks confused the guy. Nonetheless, fabulous place on the Chiswick High Road for a leisure round of drinks

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Pannacota!
Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate fondant with crunchy almond crumble!

s79VRumIFOaQ5GR43bHALA.text: I have been a regular at this place for 6 years. It's been with me through heavy hungover full English breakfasts on weekends out of boarding school to health conscious fitness fanatic refueling after a workout to lovely casual dinners with both family and friends. The one thing I can count on from High Road Brasserie is consistency.The food is always consistently good and the staff are the sweetest people ever. I come here a minimum of three times a week and usually for breakfast AND dinner. They have a huge range to choose from and a lovely ambiance. On a nice day it's hard to find a seat outside as everyone's enjoying their meal in the sun. Summer evenings are the best.Keep doing what you're doing! And if you're in the area for whatever reason, you can't do no wrong with High Road Brasserie

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Strawberries and Cream Dessert
Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Smoked Salmon and Scrambled eggs with Sides (One of my favs from here)
Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. My sister and I order sides for Meatless Monday #Vegan

hJxgfcvS--0X-tXl0VD0xQ.text: My girlfriend and I stopped off at the High Road House for a snack after hitting the driving range at Duke's Meadows.Food: We ordered the gazpacho and the quinoa salad (small size).  Both were very good and tasty.Drinks: We ordered two lattes which both came out lukewarm.  My girlfriend sent hers back only to wait 20 minutes for another lukewarm latte.Price: 20.25 GBP for two people.Ambiance: We sat outside since the weather was nice and it was filled with locals.  Service: The service is was the only thing that lacked at the brasserie.  Our waiter was way too cool for school. Would I go back?  I would because I would like to try the other items on the menu which looked good.  I just hope I get a more engaging waiter next time.

RixFJp7vXlB7ByWX0TQzkQ.text: My second favourite place in Chiswick after Charlottes bistro (round the corner) but absolutely love the brunch at High road brasserie! A menu with loads of options and amazing breakfasts.. Would recommend their pancakes with bacon and maple syrup and their full English..Always very accommodating for young kids as well which is why it's such a hotspot for the chiswick mums! They do a mean gin martini too! :)

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Coffees and Mimosas to kickstart our weekend :)
Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Yoghurt & Granola to hit the sweet spot!

pRBDGRRCHrnmH2v0JdjGzQ.text: It looked cool, but I was truly disappointed. I ordered a sandwich that was actually a toast. Yes, one loaf  of bread. I thought a simple concept as "sandwich" was universally understood. Maybe I do not speak posh.The mozarella was freezing cold, the bread was kind-of-warm and the full thing was full of salt. The chips looked really cheap, but the price wasn't.The service was slow and they need to think about team work,  it can't be you have to ask for the same thing several times to different members of staff.My napkin had a massive stain (see pictures) that I can't believe they did not see when folding.Really, why oh why is everbody eating there when its not good?Just to pretend you are ultracool. Yes, this place has the looks, but that's all.

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. Napkin I was given.
Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom. They call it sandwich. Pesto, tomato and mozzarella.

aUHv_H9Udxe2dNjyUROcYw.text: Big fan of their breakfasts. The eggs benny is particularly good, the sause is thick and creamy and the eggs are very very yellow. Service is always good. Often go on a sunday - free parking just around the corner.

-Dq69VnEzAXDMPr3tlABYg.text: It's impossible not to like this place, the food and service is always amazing. The staff have noticed that me, my family and friends are regulars and are always welcoming. I must admit I'm not the most adventurous with food and almost always end up going for steak, but it's so amazing I could never get tired of it. My only gripes are that they took away a lot of items from the drinks menu and some of the bar people don't always know how to make specific drinks. Otherwise it's the best place in Chiswick for all-round food. The prices are also very fair.

J4cuLnJaInMH6-LfehbWYQ.text: Starter salad sizes are perfect for lunch.Beautiful beautiful place on the high road. It was full, and I didn't have a reservation. I was about to walk out, but the nice lady wouldn't let me leave, and found a space for me at the end of a long table. The food was amazing, and the with he sun streaming through the windows, it was a very relaxing lunch, despite the fact that I was in a rush. The service was good, and they accommodated my need for speed. All in all a great experience! Will definitely go again, but with a reservation.

TsEzwboVKo7YMu0Dg5fumg.text: I have been to High Road Brasserie many times, often for breakfast but with the odd lunch thrown in here and there.The food is always outstanding and consistent.  The service can vary from very accomodating to a little stiff, but they have always been helpful with high-chairs and quickly getting drinks for kids (or hungover adults).I would recommend everything, but the ricotta pancakes with lemon curd are fantastic.  I relished every bite!

EALGnRG8_MUfrYRU_r-IVQ.text: Fancy french food mais oui!  Well, it's not too pretentious but they tried to still add a bit of flare when they served us so I felt fancy. A lovely warm evening in the outdoor seating area. Lovely people watching and loud chatting spot.There seemed to be a few different french bistro-ish kind of places in this area. Couldn't decide on a main so had a bunch of little things. The mussels provencal was tasty but prefer the version with cream and wine...that they don't have. Meh.And I swear I think I just make my french onion soup with too much wine for most because this is the third time I've had it in a restaurant and it's been too sweet for me. But they loaded up on the cheese topping so all was forgiven. With wine this place can get fairly expensive so choose wisely.

EQPY1HzhTMZlgjeL953vjA.text: High Road Brasserie is a very pretty, well decorated and buzzing restaurant on the Chiswick high street that I had passed by many times. The place always seems packed with people so I decided to try it out for dinner on a Thursday evening when my family was visiting. The staff were very accommodating and although there were no tables available managed to move some things around and get us seated quickly. Although they were able to get our table prepared quickly, everything else was incredibly slow. Drink orders, food orders, and even the arrival of the food took ages. I understand that it was a busy night but even waiting for the check was a lengthy process. The food was ok and a bit overpriced. I had the nicoise salad and shared the buratta appetizer to start. The salad was alright, nothing special and small for the "entree" size. The burratta was not exciting at all and was pretty dry which was quite disappointing. The place does have a nice atmosphere. I would maybe come back for drinks at the bar, but probably would not eat here again.

VMkEWHglEmdNJxJIgsv8jA.text: I was in this area, and wanting a late breakfast/brunch. I went in after reading the reviews here, on my cellphone.I had poached egg and hollandaise sauce atop smoked haddock, with toast, and two Americanos.The food was deicious, although I felt the portion was rather small, and it wouldn't exactly cost a fortune to be a bit more generous with the toast!The coffee was ok, and having milk in a proper jug might seen trivial, but it's a whole lot nicer than those annoying plastic pots! Sugar cubes were also on the table (although I don't take it myself).Service was pleasant and friendly, but not very attentive. I had to attract a waiters attention to get more coffee, and to get the bill, although I wasn't kept waiting.Minus point: I know the menu says that the 12.5% service charge is discretionary, but I HATE that. I am always happy to tip good service, and quite likely to give 15 or 20% but to have it added on really irks me. I would return, and try other dishes.

MLDtJC8Pwxi1H0wVhVI2fg.text: I have only been here 5 times but consider it one of the best places in Chiswick.The menu is varied enough so that you can go there (booking recommended!) and have what you feel like at that particular time.Firstly, it is ALWAYS busy and for me personally not the relaxing atmosphere I like to enjoy food in. The tables are also close together and the accoustics make it even harder to have a quiet, private conversation.There service is mostly good but obviously there is a lot for them to do so occasional mistakes of lack of attention are understandable and I can overlook.The food itself is mostly of a high standard. I recently had the BEST 'Sunday Roast' I have thus far sampled since moving to Chiswick 5 years ago. It was some really succulent Roast Beef with all the trimmings. The Beef was a generous portion with 1 large Yorkshire Pud and a small side dish of crispy on the outside but fluffy inside  Roast Potatoes and Carrots and some leafy stuff. The Gravy was very "French" in an alcohol way but was fine. At just under £20 it was more than the local pubs charge but was worth it.The Eggs Benedict is probably just below 'Balans' for being Chiswick's top maker of that dish.The English Breakfast I had here once was solid and almost equal to 'Carvosso's at 210', both places are expensive but for the occasional treat (I rarely eat a cooked brekkie) I would rather spend more for the quality than have it at a "Naff Cafe" for half the price.A female I was with one time had the Potatoes Dauphinause which she raved about. I tried some of her Battered Plaice goujons which we both thought were not all that good for some reason. The Tartare sauce was not to my liking either.All in all, there is a reason why this place is so popular and I recommend going there at least once.

5rv8iyQ2__XLhxhhGbZKyw.text: Part of the High Road House - see the further review on Yelp. This is the downstairs Brassiere which is open to the general public. A very up market offering and the type of place you may call in on the off chance of getting a table either inside or out for a coffee, to meet up with a few friends for a pre dinner drink or a brunch or dinner. It is very popular, so you either take you chance or consider booking a table in advance. Part of a high end group which has venues in Soho, Notting Hill and New York to mention a few which all offer a superb service and product.

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom

CE4Rv1777nfgxafeREHuAg.text: Inside and outside space, in this very slick restaurant offering everything from the full english to the very lovely stacks of butter pancakes.  If you are looking for a more healthy choice, not to worry, you got it! Try the banana and fruit stew, very nice for a cold winter morning.I have had also the pleasure of trying their set lunch, two courses for £12, this is definitely value for money.  The Aubergine Parmgianna will leave you wanting more, because its so good not because you're not full.The decor in my eyes is not the most exciting I have ever seen, dark wood tonalities with a minty green combination, lovely coloured tiles though.This restaurant can get very busy with young families or trendy west Londoners, so it is best to reserve.  Even when they are very busy the service has so far never faltered.

photos.caption: Photo of High Road Brasserie - London, United Kingdom

8-QgNAqOOsptHomOlRrR3Q.text: Stab me in the eye with a organic rose stem and punch me in the throat with a Cath Kidston door weight - this place has to be the most pukingly Chiswick place of all.It seems to be the portal by which Chiswick people arrive on this earth - beaming down with their public school educations, Tory boy husbands and beautiful blonde babies in buggys that cost more than a Toyota. Upon arrival they get given large glasses of chenin blanc by the snooty waiters and with plates of rocket and capers they spill out onto the pavement to infect the rest of W4.It certainly looks very cool inside, but the food and drinks are boring and overpriced and the staff are forcefully unpolite. It's so very Tory boy.Who'd have thought Ant and Dec could own such a place?
